Heroes of the Borderlands.name: Heroes of the Borderlands
Heroes of the Borderlands.description:
The adventure in this module is for two to four characters of levels 1–3. The adventure has no overarching plot. While there are conflicts and secrets to uncover, the story that emerges is the one your group experiences.

The adventure is divided into three self-contained journals, each of which features a different area. You don’t need to read one journal to understand the others, and you can play and revisit them in any order. The adventure areas are as follows:

The Caves of Chaos tempt adventurers with riches and glory, obtainable by any who dare brave these monster-filled caverns.

The Keep on the Borderlands is a fortified settlement where the party can rest, purchase goods and services, and interact with locals.

The Wilderness lies beyond the ken of law. Friends, foes, and surprises await explorers who traverse these untamed wilds.

Over the course of the adventure, the characters might visit these areas more than once. They don’t have to complete all the encounters in an adventure journal before exploring a different corner of the Borderlands.

Criminal and Scoundrel

Bandits use the threat of violence to take what they want. Such criminals include gang members, desperadoes, and lawless mercenaries. Yet not all bandits are motivated by greed. Some are driven to lives of crime by unjust laws, desperation, or the threats of merciless leaders.

Sentry and Watch Member

Guards protect people, places, and things, either for pay or from a sense of duty. They might perform their duties vigilantly or distractedly. Some raise alarms at the first sign of danger and defend their charges with their lives. Others flee outright if their compensation doesn’t match the danger they face. They’re perceptive, but most have little martial training. They might be bouncers, lookouts, members of a city watch, or other keen-eyed warriors.

Secret Cult Lair

Though she feigns kindness and compassion in public spaces, Ivlis believes the poor and downtrodden deserve their wretched lot. In battle, her magic is unpredictable.

On a successful check, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.

Success: Half damage, and the target moves to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s. If there is no unoccupied space, the target fails the save instead.

Fishlike Fanatic of the Deep

Kuo-toa have slimy, humanoid bodies and the heads of goggle-eyed deep-sea fish. They claim they once dominated whole worlds, their empires spanning land and sea under the blessings of piscine gods.

Kuo-toa undertake contrived plots to propel themselves to dominance, often kidnapping people to learn their secrets or making dubious sacrifices to bizarre gods. These marauders lurk in wet places, eager to shed blood and claim plunder.

These territorial guardians lurk in wetlands and jungles, surfacing from murky pools to track down trespassers and drive them out. Wardens wield weapons and shields fashioned from the husks of giant beetles, snapping turtles, and other mighty creatures. When these tools fail them, they channel the forces of nature to augment their natural attacks with poison saliva.

Nothic.name: Nothic
Nothic.description:
Witness to the Weird

Consumed by their thirst for forbidden knowledge, nothics are cursed lore seekers transformed by secrets never meant to be known. The bodies of these former scholars are warped into otherworldly shapes, each with a head dominated by a gigantic, unblinking eye.

Rotting Gaze.name: Rotting Gaze
Rotting Gaze.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=k4jetEkSCPApNFgz]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=k4jetEkSCPApNFgz]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=k4jetEkSCPApNFgz]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Weird Insight.name: Weird Insight
Weird Insight.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=o6eFmn0HWGbQjzdG]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=o6eFmn0HWGbQjzdG]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=o6eFmn0HWGbQjzdG]] feet.

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically learns one fact or secret about the target.

Ogre.name: Ogre
Ogre.description:
Raging Hulk and Hoarder

Ogres are 10-foot-tall brutes that overwhelm their foes and take what spoils they please. Ogre raiders ally with other evil forces in return for food, riches, and promises of battle.

Ogre Zombie.name: Ogre Zombie
Ogre Zombie.description:
Relentless Reanimated Corpse

Ogre zombies serve as tireless labor and undying weapons of war. These massive zombies possess the size and strength to break through barriers that repel smaller zombies.

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

Owlbear.name: Owlbear
Owlbear.description:
Magically Perfected Predator

Created long ago by mages, owlbears combine keen avian eyes, thick feathers, and a tearing beak with a mighty bearlike frame. Despite their magical origins, owlbears have propagated and spread to wildernesses across the multiverse. They are tenacious hunters that might track prey over miles and rarely give up their hunts.

Pral.name: Pral
Pral.description:
The Most Infamous Bandit of the Borderlands

Pral’s boyishly handsome, self-assured grin graces wanted posters throughout the Borderlands. A self-proclaimed “gentleman thief,” Pral abides by a strict personal code. He never kills, and he always upholds his end of any bargain he makes. A lover of good food, comfortable lodgings, and stylish clothing, Pral squanders the spoils of each robbery on his extravagant lifestyle.

Red Dragon Wyrmling.name: Red Dragon Wyrmling
Red Dragon Wyrmling.description:
Dragon of Greed and Devastation

Red dragon wyrmlings are born destroyers. From a young age, they delight in igniting objects and creatures alike. They sometimes restrain themselves from scorching creatures to instead bully others into following their orders and bringing them gifts.

Fire Breath.name: Fire Breath
Fire Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Skeleton.name: Skeleton
Skeleton.description:
Ossified Evil

Skeletons are reanimated Humanoid bones bearing the equipment they had in life. They have rudimentary faculties and greater agility than zombies and similar shambling corpses.

Sprite Skirmisher.name: Sprite Skirmisher
Sprite Skirmisher.description:
Elusive Defender of Fey Realms

Sprites are wee spirits of nature that can see the innate goodness or wickedness of other creatures. Those that enter their realms with good intentions might be treated with tiny feasts and celebrations. The wicked face nasty tricks and bold ambushes at the hands of invisible sprite defenders.

Enchanting Bow.name: Enchanting Bow
Enchanting Bow.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Heart Sight.name: Heart Sight
Heart Sight.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=NqVrZShDV1L3zBA3]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=NqVrZShDV1L3zBA3]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=NqVrZShDV1L3zBA3]] feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see (Celestials, Fiends, and Undead automatically fail the save).

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the target’s emotions and alignment.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

FAek73jM5CyQOO60.name: Invisibility
FAek73jM5CyQOO60.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Blurred Form.name: Blurred Form
Blurred Form.description: Attack rolls against the [[lookup @name lowercase]] are made with Disadvantage unless the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] explodes [[lookup @activation.condition activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]].

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Steam Breath.name: Steam Breath
Steam Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5iI1KQRWrdMGh9sy]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=5iI1KQRWrdMGh9sy]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target’s Speed decreases by 10 feet until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] next turn..

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Being underwater doesn’t grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

Stirge.name: Stirge
Stirge.description:
Notorious, Clinging Bloodsucker

Stirges are bat-size vermin with dagger-length proboscises that attach to other creatures and drain life from them. Stirges are most active at night and hide in shadowy places during the day. If disturbed, they take flight and defend themselves.

Proboscis.name: Proboscis
Proboscis.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attaches to the target. While attached, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t make Proboscis attacks, and the target takes [[/damage average activity=5xwoPMBiaRBqjFav]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the [[lookup @name lowercase]] as an action.

Vinx.name: Vinx
Vinx.description:
Down-on-Her-Luck Dwarf Spelunker

This itinerant explorer knows the caves around the Keep on the Borderlands better than anyone else. Vinx frequently delves these caves in search of treasure.

Recently, Vinx got caught in a bind while pursuing a stolen family heirloom. When she gets loose, those goblins won’t know what hit them!

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes two attacks, using [[/item Shortsword]] and [[/item Sling]] in any combination.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmNecroticSword0]] or [[/item .mmNecroticBow000]] in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmLifeDrain00000]].

Drink Life.name: Drink Life
Drink Life.description:
Life Drain.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Zombie.name: Zombie
Zombie.description:
Relentless Animated Corpse

Zombies are unthinking, reanimated corpses, often gruesomely marred by decay. They serve whatever supernatural force animates them—typically evil necromancers or fiendish spirits.

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

Andrella.name: Andrella
Andrella.description:
Human Captain of the Guard

This captain is strong, stern, and just.

Perfect Posture. Andrella is as strict with her posture as she is with the law.

Role Model. Many of the keep’s young people admire Andrella and enjoy her goodhearted mentorship.

Rumors

“A dastardly bandit, Pral, accosts travelers along the trail. Apparently he’s quite handsome; I’m sure he’ll look even better behind bars.” (True)

“The castellan tells me monsters are drawn to the Caves of Chaos in droves. I wonder why.” (True)

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .qJUgq4viT1HD2ftt]] or [[/item .CneRFiVxRtCmo8Pl]] in any combination.

Bartho.name: Bartho
Bartho.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.77W5x4kFgTpDB0CZ caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Gate Guard

This gullible recruit spends more time dreaming than patrolling.

Distractable. Bartho is easily distracted from his post because he’d rather be doing anything else.

Sleepy. Bartho likes to catch a few winks during the night shift.

Rumors

“If you can’t afford a bed at the inn, Cornflower will let you sleep in the barn. The hay’s real comfy.” (True)

“Minotaurs aren’t real. They’re just a myth told to scare little children from wandering into caves.” (False)

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Cornflower.name: Cornflower
Cornflower.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.vJoRnCEcsA3SRrHM caption=false classes="right three"]

Halfling Barn Hand

This spunky stable hand isn’t afraid to get her hands dirty.

Animal Lover. Cornflower’s best friends are all barn animals.

Idiomatic. Cornflower likes to use animal idioms, such as “busy bee,” “chicken out,” and “hold your horses.”

Rumors

“Did you know animals have all sorts of special glands? Giant fire beetles are like big glowing cave lanterns! Isn’t nature amazing?” (True)

“Careful if you go trekking into the wilderness. The tamaracks are overrun with giant spiders.” (True)

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a +2 bonus to one skill of the DM’s choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Dwern.name: Dwern
Dwern.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.vpaiuOwQyN52gXQo caption=false classes="right three"]

Dwarf Scribe

This gruff scribe prefers the company of books over people.

Bookworm. Dwern has read more books than anyone else in the keep.

Curmudgeonly. Dwern is ill-tempered toward younger people—which, to him, are most people.

Rumors

“The guild house’s library boasts a modest but impressive collection of books on history and magic.” (True)

“There’s an ancient statue somewhere in the forests north of the keep. It was once the site of strange rituals. Some say it still is.” (True)

Elandra.name: Elandra
Elandra.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.XiQhoH6verFXNJRZ caption=false classes="right three"]

Elf Adviser

Elandra provides guidance to the castellan and citizens of the keep.

Cautious. When presented with a choice, Elandra typically prefers the option with the least amount of risk.

Complainer. Nothing is ever good enough for Elandra.

Rumors

“Every night, the tavern hosts a rowdy little drinking game with prizes. It’s not for me.” (True)

“Kalista, the keep’s blacksmith, doesn’t sell weapons to adventurers. If you want to know why, ask her.” (True)

Fazzir.name: Fazzir
Fazzir.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.AgXkGN9VdcYEkobx caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Priest

This spiritual leader offers counsel and healing to all who seek the temple.

Altruistic. Fazzir puts the needs of others before his own.

Trusting. Fazzir always assumes the best of people.

Rumors

“The keep’s former priest, Ivlis, left a large collection of books on all matter of subjects—even occult rituals.” (True)

“Anyone entering the inner bailey is bound to cross paths with Shannik, sergeant of the guard. I think he’s a little too hard on new recruits.” (True)

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Celestial Radiance]] attacks.

Raise the Dead.name: Raise the Dead
Raise the Dead.description:
In a ritual that takes 8 hours, the [[lookup @name]] touches a creature that has died within the past 7 days.

That creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. The curate canʼt revive a creature that died of old age.

Healer's Touch.name: Healer's Touch
Healer's Touch.description: The [[lookup @name]] touches another creature. That creature regains [[/healing]] Hit Points.

Gala.name: Gala
Gala.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.zyXJgTD6m1aoSF7i caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Gate Guard

Though she’s memorized all the keep’s laws, this guard still has much to learn.

By the Books. Gala clings to the keep’s laws—and often recites them aloud—whenever she must make a decision.

Naive. Gala believes that life is fair, people mostly tell the truth, and good always prevails.

Rumors

“I’ve heard the captain of the guard, @UUID[JournalEntry.hotbNpcs00000000.JournalEntryPage.a1gOVKXrvzfgImZ9]{Andrella}, plans to retire soon.” (False)

“The keep’s coat of arms honors its cavalry, thirty riders strong. I hope to become one.” (True)

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Haldryck.name: Haldryck
Haldryck.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.iIi1lD49eeYn6WtG caption=false classes="right three"]

Dwarf Innkeeper

Jovial and accommodating, Haldryck is a fast friend to anyone who visits his inn.

Epicurean. Good food and drink are the keys to Haldryck’s heart.

Overseller. Haldryck advertises his inn’s basic necessities—like clean sheets and doors with locks—as luxury amenities.

Rumors

“The food at the tavern is the best in the Borderlands!” (Doubtful)

“My inn is the only place visitors to the keep can stay overnight.” (False)

Kalista.name: Kalista
Kalista.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.S0pe3tkg2MUke8xd caption=false classes="right three"]

Dwarf Blacksmith

The keep’s taciturn, hardworking smith prefers to let her hammer do the talking.

Standoffish. Kalista is curt toward people she doesn’t know, especially adventurers.

Stern. Kalista never cracks a smile.

Rumors

“Every now and then, adventurers return from the Caves of Chaos with magic weapons, but most of the time they don’t come back at all.” (True)

“Mind your equipment around oozes. Their touch can corrode even the sturdiest of metals.” (True)

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a +2 bonus to one skill of the DM’s choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Lenk.name: Lenk
Lenk.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.QVHdjpOzl8sZEOGp caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Jeweler

This elderly jeweler can identify and appraise any gemstone.

Faultfinder. Lenk has a knack for spotting flaws, be they in things or people.

Pessimistic. Lenk always sees the worst part of any situation.

Rumors

“Your money isn’t safe at the bank. I hear a burglar broke in recently and stole every last coin.” (Partially true; the burglar was unsuccessful)

“Some stones hide things. The next time you’re in an ancient dungeon or old cave, inspect the walls closely. You just might find a secret door.” (True)

Mallyn.name: Mallyn
Mallyn.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.c1u6Pa3pifl8fayf caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Traveler

This young wayfarer’s heart is filled with wanderlust.

Easy Come, Easy Go. Mallyn doesn’t get attached to possessions or acquaintances.

Inquisitive. Mallyn eagerly asks strangers lots of questions.

Rumors

“Don’t wander into the fens unless you’re looking for trouble. The lizardfolk there don’t like visitors.” (True)

“My uncle Umbrusk runs the tavern in the keep. He hears all kinds of gossip in the taproom.” (True)

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a +2 bonus to one skill of the DM’s choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Oleira.name: Oleira
Oleira.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.6aNQoD30dHMuthfC caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Shopkeeper

This merchant and mother of two deals in wares ranging from common trade goods to curious bric-a-brac.

Fastidious. Oleira can’t stand dusty wares. Every item must be spotless.

Parental. Oleira sometimes treats her customers like she does her children.

Rumors

“A hermit, Xanthe, was cast out of the keep for practicing evil magic. I hear she was in a cult. Think of the children!” (False)

“The keep’s two outer gate guards, Bartho and Gala, are both so green. I’m not sure which of them I trust less to protect us.” (True)

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a +2 bonus to one skill of the DM’s choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Quink.name: Quink
Quink.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.sor3xRKJIyCjEZyQ caption=false classes="right three"]

Halfling Baker

Quink is a miserly moneylender.

Frugal. Quink never budges on matters of money.

Garrulous. Conversations with Quink last twice as long as they should.

Rumors

“Good supplies are a sound investment. Ruckus at the provisioner’s shop can outfit you with quality gear.” (True)

“I’ve heard dragons are a bit like bankers—we obsess over every coin. If you ever encounter a dragon, don’t touch its hoard unless you want to meet its wrath.” (True)

Ruckus.name: Ruckus
Ruckus.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.8hTSwoa4PtqEn7Xg caption=false classes="right three"]

Halfling Shopkeeper

The owner of the provisioner’s shop is small but has a big personality.

Loud. Ruckus compensates for his short stature by shouting up to taller customers.

Everything Has a Place. Despite the mess in his shop, Ruckus always knows exactly where to find just what he’s looking for.

Rumors

“I hear goblins throw wild parties.” (Oh Yeah!)

“@UUID[JournalEntry.hotbNpcs00000000.JournalEntryPage.0SpEYRLrHK7pKQ87]{Lenk} the jeweler gives a fair price for gems and precious stones. He lives in the private apartments.” (True)

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a +2 bonus to one skill of the DM’s choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Shannik.name: Shannik
Shannik.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.YMh7zqh58U9zdCmW caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Sergeant of the Guard

Captain Andrella’s second in command brooks no evildoers.

Brusque. When Shannik can substitute a reply with a grunt, he does so.

Shortsighted. Shannik’s plans and actions fail to account for long-term repercussions.

Rumors

“An adventurer is only as good as their gear. Oleira at the trader’s shop is a friend of mine. She can sell you armor and weapons.” (True)

“A real soldier can sleep off any injury. After a battle, I usually rent a bed at the inn. I always sleep better there.” (True)

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .qJUgq4viT1HD2ftt]] or [[/item .CneRFiVxRtCmo8Pl]] in any combination.

Toryn.name: Toryn
Toryn.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.bGP7P5R5Cs6YHsu9 caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Guild Master

This guild master helps fellow artisans get a good deal for their wares and services.

Judgmental. Toryn looks down on artisans who refuse to join the guild.

Witty. Toryn says smart things and always has the last word.

Rumors

“Castellan Winvarle is the ultimate authority in the keep.” (True)

“The Borderlands are home to all sorts of trades: musicians, mercenaries, treasure-seekers, spies even monsters can have a profession. My advice? Pay them what they ask.” (True)

Umbrusk.name: Umbrusk
Umbrusk.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.27ztRbQzwT0svaFm caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Barkeep

Umbrusk serves up drinks, food, and gossip at the keep’s tavern.

Eavesdropper. Umbrusk listens to his patrons’ conversations.

Good Memory. Umbrusk never forgets a face or name.

Rumors

“A traveler named Mallyn walks the trails outside the keep. If you meet her, say hello for me! She’s my niece.” (True)

“Whenever I order a cake, it gets seized by goblins, roadside bandits—you name it. I guess everybody likes dessert.” (True)

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a +2 bonus to one skill of the DM’s choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Winvarle.name: Winvarle
Winvarle.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.nwtfm4IpPaW1XZlq caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Castellan

The keep’s noble commander leads his soldiers whenever the keep comes under attack.

Idealistic. Winvarle’s ideals are rooted in lofty notions of righteousness.

Oblivious. While he excels at battle strategy, Winvarle scarcely knows the inner workings of his own keep.

Rumors

“The Cult of Chaos is an affront to all that is good.” (True)

“Anyone can pledge to defend the keep. Talk to Andrella in the inner gatehouse if you’d like to join the keep’s defenders.” (True)

Xanthe.name: Xanthe
Xanthe.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.DL74QYd8WgX21TVz caption=false classes="right three"]

Elf Hermit

One of the Borderlands’ oldest and wisest residents was banished from the keep for crimes she didn’t commit.

Bad Reputation. Xanthe was wrongfully exiled for using occult magic.

Distrustful. Xanthe doesn’t trust strangers.

Rumors

“A spy named Jacko prowls the fens. Be wary if you meet him. He’ll do anything for coin—even kill.” (True)

“The temple’s head priest is a demon worshiper.” (Partially true; Xanthe is referring to Ivlis, the former priest)

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a +2 bonus to one skill of the DM’s choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Yvette.name: Yvette
Yvette.description:
@Embed[JournalEntry.hotbArtHandouts0.JournalEntryPage.rmKQidDVmrBmSckW caption=false classes="right three"]

Human Bank Guard

This corrupt guard exploits her station for selfish ends.

Bitter. Yvette thinks the world owes her.

Grifter. Yvette is always hunting for new ways to get rich quick.

Rumors

“There’s an alms box at the temple that usually contains a few gold pieces. I hear Fazzir doesn’t even lock it.” (True)

“If you find yourself face to face with an owlbear, just play dead. It will quickly get bored and move on.” (False)

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Cleric (Level 1).name: Cleric (Level 1)
Cleric (Level 1).description:
Playing a Cleric

Choose this class if you want to play a holy warrior who invokes divine magic to heal, bolster, and smite.

Cleric Tips. In combat, defend your fellow party members with your trusty Mace and spells like Guiding Bolt. When other characters take damage, you can cast Cure Wounds to keep them fighting.

Out of combat, your high Wisdom helps you discern a person’s moods or intentions (Insight) or notice something that’s easy to miss (Perception).

Recommended Origin. If you need help deciding your origin, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.hotbAcolyte00000]{Acolyte} Background and the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.phbspDwarf000000]{Dwarf} Species complement this class well.

Cleric.name: Cleric
Cleric.description:
Core Cleric Traits

Primary Ability

Wisdom

Hit Point Die

D8 per Cleric level

Saving Throw Proficiencies

Wisdom and Charisma

Skill Proficiencies

Choose 2: History, Insight, Medicine, Persuasion, or Religion

Weapon Proficiencies

Simple weapons

Armor Training

Light and Medium armor and Shields

Starting Equipment

Choose A or B: (A) @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmChainShirt]{Chain Shirt}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmShield0000]{Shield}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepMace000000]{Mace}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPriestsPack]{Priest's Pack}, and [[/award 7GP]]; or (B) [[/award 110GP]]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixClass.JournalEntryPage.phbclcCleric0000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Becoming a Cleric …

As a Level 1 Character

  • Gain all the traits in the Core Cleric Traits table.
  • Gain the Cleric's level 1 features, which are listed in the Cleric Features table.

As a Multiclass Character

  • Gain the following traits from the Core Cleric Traits table: Hit Point Die and training with Light and Medium armor and Shields.
  • Gain the Cleric's level 1 features, which are listed in the Cleric Features table. See the multiclassing rules in chapter 2 to determine your available spell slots.

Divine Order Choice.title: Divine Order Choice
Divine Order Choice.hint: You have dedicated yourself to one of the following sacred roles of your choice.

Blessed Strikes Choice.title: Blessed Strikes Choice
Blessed Strikes Choice.hint: Divine power infuses you in battle. You gain one of the following options of your choice (if you get either option from a Cleric subclass in an older book, use only the option you choose for this feature).

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
You have learned to cast spells through prayer and meditation. See @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.b2QVn25z2N1ykWpf]{chapter 7} for the rules on spellcasting. The information below details how you use those rules with Cleric spells, which appear on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.SkHptN2PTzFGDaEj]{Cleric spell list}.

Cantrips. You know three cantrips of your choice from the Cleric spell list. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGuidance00]{Guidance}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSacredFlam]{Sacred Flame}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy} are recommended.

Whenever you gain a Cleric level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Cleric spell list.

When you reach Cleric levels 4 and 10, you learn another cantrip of your choice from the Cleric spell list, as shown in the Cantrips column of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbCleric0000000.JournalEntryPage.acPyA6A4DQBSnuZB#class-features]{Cleric Features} table.

Spell Slots. The Cleric Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Long Rest.

Prepared Spells of Level 1+. You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 spells from the Cleric spell list. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCureWounds]{Cure Wounds}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShieldofFa]{Shield of Faith} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Cleric levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Cleric Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Cleric spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Cleric, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

If another Cleric feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Cleric spells for you.

Changing Your Prepared Spells. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change your list of prepared spells, replacing any of the spells there with other Cleric spells for which you have spell slots.

Spellcasting Ability. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Cleric spells.

Spellcasting Focus. You can use a Holy Symbol as a Spellcasting Focus for your Cleric spells.

Divine Order.name: Divine Order
Divine Order.description:
You have dedicated yourself to one of the following sacred roles of your choice.

Protector. Trained for battle, you gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Heavy armor.

Thaumaturge. You know one extra cantrip from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.SkHptN2PTzFGDaEj]{Cleric spell list}. In addition, your mystical connection to the divine gives you a bonus to your Intelligence (Arcana or Religion) checks. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

Foundry Note

During advancement you will be able to choose which option you prefer.

Divine Order: Thaumaturge.name: Divine Order: Thaumaturge
Divine Order: Thaumaturge.description:
You have dedicated yourself to the following sacred role:

Thaumaturge. You know one extra cantrip from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.SkHptN2PTzFGDaEj]{Cleric spell list}. In addition, your mystical connection to the divine gives you a bonus to your Intelligence (Arcana or Religion) checks. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1, currently [[lookup @abilities.wis.mod]]).

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect which increases the number of cantrips you can know and grants the bonus to your Intelligence (Arcana or Religion) checks.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: 祝福
Blessed.description: 在法术终止前，每当你进行攻击检定或豁免检定时，都可以在检定结果中额外加入 1d4。

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
You hurl a bolt of light toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 Radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from Half Cover or Three-Quarters Cover for this save.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Shield of Faith.name: Shield of Faith
Shield of Faith.description: A shimmering field surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

Shimmering Field.name: Shimmering Field
Shimmering Field.description: The target gains a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Toll the Dead.name: Toll the Dead
Toll the Dead.description:
You point at one creature you can see within range, and the single chime of a dolorous bell is audible within 10 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d8 Necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its Hit Points, it instead takes 1d12 Necrotic damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by one die when you reach levels 5 (2d8 or 2d12), 11 (3d8 or 3d12), and 17 (4d8 or 4d12).

affects.special: creature missing any of its Hit Points

Channel Divinity.name: Channel Divinity
Channel Divinity.description:
You can channel divine energy directly from the Outer Planes to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Divine Spark and Turn Undead, each of which is described below. Each time you use this class's Channel Divinity, choose which Channel Divinity effect from this class to create. You gain additional effect options at higher Cleric levels.

You can use this class's Channel Divinity twice. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. You gain additional uses when you reach certain Cleric levels, as shown in the Channel Divinity column of the Cleric Features table.

If a Channel Divinity effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals the spell save DC from this class's Spellcasting feature.

Divine Spark. As a Magic action, you point your Holy Symbol at another creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself and focus divine energy at it. Roll 1d8 and add your Wisdom modifier. You either restore Hit Points to the creature equal to that total or force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice) equal to that total. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage (round down).

You roll an additional d8 when you reach Cleric levels 7 (2d8), 13 (3d8), and 18 (4d8).

Turn Undead. As a Magic action, you present your Holy Symbol and censure Undead creatures. Each Undead of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its save, it has the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions for 1 minute. For that duration, it tries to move as far from you as it can on its turns. This effect ends early on the creature if it takes any damage, if you have the Incapacitated condition, or if you die.

Foundry Note

This feature will automatically restore 1 use on a Short Rest and all on a Long Rest. The uses scale automatically as you level up.

The Divine Spark: Heal activity includes the healing effect.

The Divine Spark: Save activity includes the saving throw.

The Turn Undead activity includes an Active Effect that applies the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions.

Inflict Wounds.name: Inflict Wounds
Inflict Wounds.description:
A creature you touch makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed Strikes Choice.title: Blessed Strikes Choice
Blessed Strikes Choice.hint: Divine power infuses you in battle. You gain one of the following options of your choice (if you get either option from a Cleric subclass in an older book, use only the option you choose for this feature).

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
You have learned to cast spells through prayer and meditation. See @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.b2QVn25z2N1ykWpf]{chapter 7} for the rules on spellcasting. The information below details how you use those rules with Cleric spells, which appear on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.SkHptN2PTzFGDaEj]{Cleric spell list}.

Cantrips. You know three cantrips of your choice from the Cleric spell list. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGuidance00]{Guidance}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSacredFlam]{Sacred Flame}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy} are recommended.

Whenever you gain a Cleric level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Cleric spell list.

When you reach Cleric levels 4 and 10, you learn another cantrip of your choice from the Cleric spell list, as shown in the Cantrips column of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbCleric0000000.JournalEntryPage.acPyA6A4DQBSnuZB#class-features]{Cleric Features} table.

Spell Slots. The Cleric Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Long Rest.

Prepared Spells of Level 1+. You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 spells from the Cleric spell list. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCureWounds]{Cure Wounds}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{Guiding Bolt}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShieldofFa]{Shield of Faith} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Cleric levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Cleric Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Cleric spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Cleric, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

If another Cleric feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Cleric spells for you.

Changing Your Prepared Spells. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change your list of prepared spells, replacing any of the spells there with other Cleric spells for which you have spell slots.

Spellcasting Ability. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Cleric spells.

Spellcasting Focus. You can use a Holy Symbol as a Spellcasting Focus for your Cleric spells.

Divine Order.name: Divine Order
Divine Order.description:
You have dedicated yourself to one of the following sacred roles of your choice.

Protector. Trained for battle, you gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Heavy armor.

Thaumaturge. You know one extra cantrip from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.SkHptN2PTzFGDaEj]{Cleric spell list}. In addition, your mystical connection to the divine gives you a bonus to your Intelligence (Arcana or Religion) checks. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

Foundry Note

During advancement you will be able to choose which option you prefer.

Divine Order: Thaumaturge.name: Divine Order: Thaumaturge
Divine Order: Thaumaturge.description:
You have dedicated yourself to the following sacred role:

Thaumaturge. You know one extra cantrip from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbSpells0000000.JournalEntryPage.SkHptN2PTzFGDaEj]{Cleric spell list}. In addition, your mystical connection to the divine gives you a bonus to your Intelligence (Arcana or Religion) checks. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1, currently [[lookup @abilities.wis.mod]]).

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect which increases the number of cantrips you can know and grants the bonus to your Intelligence (Arcana or Religion) checks.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
You hurl a bolt of light toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 Radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from Half Cover or Three-Quarters Cover for this save.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Shield of Faith.name: Shield of Faith
Shield of Faith.description: A shimmering field surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

Shimmering Field.name: Shimmering Field
Shimmering Field.description: The target gains a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Toll the Dead.name: Toll the Dead
Toll the Dead.description:
You point at one creature you can see within range, and the single chime of a dolorous bell is audible within 10 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d8 Necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its Hit Points, it instead takes 1d12 Necrotic damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by one die when you reach levels 5 (2d8 or 2d12), 11 (3d8 or 3d12), and 17 (4d8 or 4d12).

affects.special: creature missing any of its Hit Points

Channel Divinity.name: Channel Divinity
Channel Divinity.description:
You can channel divine energy directly from the Outer Planes to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Divine Spark and Turn Undead, each of which is described below. Each time you use this class's Channel Divinity, choose which Channel Divinity effect from this class to create. You gain additional effect options at higher Cleric levels.

You can use this class's Channel Divinity twice. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. You gain additional uses when you reach certain Cleric levels, as shown in the Channel Divinity column of the Cleric Features table.

If a Channel Divinity effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals the spell save DC from this class's Spellcasting feature.

Divine Spark. As a Magic action, you point your Holy Symbol at another creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself and focus divine energy at it. Roll 1d8 and add your Wisdom modifier. You either restore Hit Points to the creature equal to that total or force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice) equal to that total. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage (round down).

You roll an additional d8 when you reach Cleric levels 7 (2d8), 13 (3d8), and 18 (4d8).

Turn Undead. As a Magic action, you present your Holy Symbol and censure Undead creatures. Each Undead of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its save, it has the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions for 1 minute. For that duration, it tries to move as far from you as it can on its turns. This effect ends early on the creature if it takes any damage, if you have the Incapacitated condition, or if you die.

Foundry Note

This feature will automatically restore 1 use on a Short Rest and all on a Long Rest. The uses scale automatically as you level up.

The Divine Spark: Heal activity includes the healing effect.

The Divine Spark: Save activity includes the saving throw.

The Turn Undead activity includes an Active Effect that applies the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions.

Inflict Wounds.name: Inflict Wounds
Inflict Wounds.description:
A creature you touch makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

Life Domain.name: Life Domain
Life Domain.description:
Soothe the Hurts of the World

The Life Domain focuses on the positive energy that helps sustain all life in the multiverse. Clerics who tap into this domain are masters of healing, using that life force to cure many hurts.

Existence itself relies on the positive energy associated with this domain, so a Cleric of almost any religious tradition might choose it. This domain is particularly associated with agricultural deities, gods of healing or endurance, and gods of home and community. Religious orders of healing also seek the magic of this domain.

Aid.name: Aid
Aid.description:
选择法术距离内至多三个生物。每个目标的生命值上限和当前生命值 在法术持续时间内提高 5 点。

升环施法：使用的法术位每比二环高一环，每个目标的生命值就额外提高 5 点。

Foundry Note

默认的“治疗”行为配置了多个动态效果，用以代表该法术所提供的临时最大生命值上限。

用户应根据施放该法术时所使用的法术位等级，应用相应的动态效果

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: 祝福
Blessed.description: 在法术终止前，每当你进行攻击检定或豁免检定时，都可以在检定结果中额外加入 1d4。

Disciple of Life.name: Disciple of Life
Disciple of Life.description:
When a spell you cast with a spell slot restores Hit Points to a creature, that creature regains additional Hit Points on the turn you cast the spell. The additional Hit Points equal 2 plus the spell slot's level.

Foundry Note

This feature includes a healing activity. Set the scale to the spell slot level you cast and it will provide a healing roll for you.

Life Domain Spells.name: Life Domain Spells
Life Domain Spells.description:
Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Life Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

Preserve Life.name: Preserve Life
Preserve Life.description:
As a Magic action, you present your Holy Symbol and expend a use of your Channel Divinity to evoke healing energy that can restore a number of Hit Points equal to five times your Cleric level. Choose &Reference[Bloodied] creatures within 30 feet of yourself (which can include you), and divide those Hit Points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half its Hit Point maximum.

Foundry Note

The Heal activity does not automatically restrict the HP gained to 50% of the target's max.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

materials.value: a shard of glass from a mirror

Warded.name: Warded
Warded.description:
Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell.

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Cleric (Level 3, Light Domain).name: Cleric (Level 3, Light Domain)
Cleric (Level 3, Light Domain).description:
Playing a Cleric

Choose this class if you want to play a holy warrior who invokes divine magic to heal, bolster, and smite.

Cleric Tips. In combat, defend your fellow party members with your trusty Mace and spells like Guiding Bolt. When other characters take damage, you can cast Cure Wounds to keep them fighting.

Out of combat, your high Wisdom helps you discern a person’s moods or intentions (Insight) or notice something that’s easy to miss (Perception).

Recommended Origin. If you need help deciding your origin, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.hotbAcolyte00000]{Acolyte} Background and the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.phbspDwarf000000]{Dwarf} Species complement this class well.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixClass.JournalEntryPage.phbclcCleric0000 inline classes="free-rules-embed"]

Becoming a Cleric …

As a Level 1 Character

  • Gain all the traits in the Core Cleric Traits table.
  • Gain the Cleric's level 1 features, which are listed in the Cleric Features table.

As a Multiclass Character

  • Gain the following traits from the Core Cleric Traits table: Hit Point Die and training with Light and Medium armor and Shields.
  • Gain the Cleric's level 1 features, which are listed in the Cleric Features table. See the multiclassing rules in chapter 2 to determine your available spell slots.

If the creature fails its save, it has the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions for 1 minute. For that duration, it tries to move as far from you as it can on its turns. This effect ends early on the creature if it takes any damage, if you have the Incapacitated condition, or if you die.

Foundry Note

This feature will automatically restore 1 use on a Short Rest and all on a Long Rest. The uses scale automatically as you level up.

The Divine Spark: Heal activity includes the healing effect.

The Divine Spark: Save activity includes the saving throw.

The Turn Undead activity includes an Active Effect that applies the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions.

Inflict Wounds.name: Inflict Wounds
Inflict Wounds.description:
A creature you touch makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

materials.value: a shard of glass from a mirror

Warded.name: Warded
Warded.description:
Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell.

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Light Domain.name: Light Domain
Light Domain.description:
Bring Light to Banish Darkness

The Light Domain emphasizes the divine power to bring about blazing fire and revelation. Clerics who wield this power are enlightened souls infused with radiance and the power of their deities' discerning vision, charged with chasing away lies and burning away darkness.

The Light Domain is associated with gods of truth, vigilance, beauty, insight, and renewal. Some of these gods are identified with the sun or as charioteers who guide the sun across the sky. Others are sentinels who pierce deception. Some are deities of beauty and artistry who teach that art is a vehicle for the soul's improvement.

Burning Hands.name: Burning Hands
Burning Hands.description:
A thin sheet of flames shoots forth from you. Each creature in a 15-foot Cone makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the Cone that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Scorching Ray.name: Scorching Ray
Scorching Ray.description:
You hurl three fiery rays. You can hurl them at one target within range or at several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 Fire damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create one additional ray for each spell slot level above 2.

[[@item.level + 1]]{Total Rays}

See Invisibility.name: See Invisibility
See Invisibility.description: For the duration, you see creatures and objects that have the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

Light Domain Spells.name: Light Domain Spells
Light Domain Spells.description:
Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Light Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

Radiance of the Dawn.name: Radiance of the Dawn
Radiance of the Dawn.description: As a Magic action, you present your Holy Symbol and expend a use of your Channel Divinity to emit a flash of light in a 30-foot Emanation originating from yourself. Any magical &Reference[Darkness]—such as that created by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness} spell—in that area is dispelled. Additionally, each creature of your choice in that area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking Radiant damage equal to 2d10 plus your Cleric level on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Warding Flare.name: Warding Flare
Warding Flare.description:
When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of yourself makes an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to impose Disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before it hits or misses.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once, currently [[lookup @abilities.wis.mod]]). You regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

The Flare activity includes a 30 foot emanation for identifying impacted creatures. It does not automate the Disadvantage.

Flare.name: Flare
Flare.condition: When a creature you can see within 30 feet makes an attack roll

Fighter (Level 1).name: Fighter (Level 1)
Fighter (Level 1).description:
Playing a Fighter

Choose this class if you want to play a warrior who can hold the line and access special weapon properties.

Fighter Tips. Leap into the fray and shake off damage with Second Wind. When you take the Attack action, don’t forget about the Mastery Properties of your weapons.

Out of combat, your high Strength helps you overcome physical obstacles, like breaking down doors or climbing a steep wall (Athletics). Look for chances to procure new armor and weapons—you can use them all!

Recommended Origin. If you need help deciding your origin, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.hotbSoldier00000]{Soldier} Background and the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.phbspHuman000000]{Human} Species complement this class well.

Lantern.name: Lantern
Lantern.description: A Lantern casts Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet. As a Bonus Action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to Dim Light in a 5-foot radius, or raise it again.

Becoming a Fighter …

As a Level 1 Character

  • Gain all the traits in the Core Fighter Traits table.
  • Gain the Fighter's level 1 features, which are listed in the Fighter Features table.

As a Multiclass Character

  • Gain the following traits from the Core Fighter Traits table: Hit Point Die, proficiency with Martial weapons, and training with Light and Medium armor and Shields.
  • Gain the Fighter's level 1 features, which are listed in the Fighter Features table.

Fighting Style.name: Fighting Style
Fighting Style.description:
You have honed your martial prowess and gain a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbFeats00000000.JournalEntryPage.sbHImaCB8ZMEHYkb]{Fighting Style feat} of your choice. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.feats24.Item.phbfstDefense000]{Defense} is recommended.

Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace the feat you chose with a different Fighting Style feat.

Second Wind.name: Second Wind
Second Wind.description:
You have a limited well of physical and mental stamina that you can draw on. As a Bonus Action, you can use it to regain Hit Points equal to 1d10 plus your Fighter level.

You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

When you reach certain Fighter levels, you gain more uses of this feature, as shown in the Second Wind column of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbFighter000000.JournalEntryPage.wDELe3k25FQvYdrq#class-features]{Fighter Features} table.

Foundry Note

This feature automatically scales in usage and recovers the correct number of uses on a Short and Long Rest.

Weapon Mastery.name: Weapon Mastery
Weapon Mastery.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of three kinds of Simple or Martial weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Fighter levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbFighter000000.JournalEntryPage.wDELe3k25FQvYdrq#class-features]{Fighter Features} table.

Foundry Note

To change your masteries toggle on the "Edit" mode of your sheet. On the "Details" tab click on the cog icon next to "Weapons" in the bottom right. You can place a check in the mastery column of your chosen weapons.

Rogue (Level 1).name: Rogue (Level 1)
Rogue (Level 1).description:
Playing a Rogue

Choose this class if you want to play an antihero who launches deadly strikes while avoiding harm through stealth.

Rogue Tips. In combat, use a combination of stealth, positioning, and the Vex property of your Shortsword or Shortbow to make attacks with Advantage and deal extra damage with Sneak Attack. The Light property allows you to attack with your Dagger and Shortsword on the same turn, increasing the likelihood of this extra damage.

Your high Dexterity helps you escape notice (Stealth) and pick locks with your Thieves’ Tools (Sleight of Hand). You’re also a capable liar (Deception).

Recommended Origin. If you need help deciding your origin, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.hotbCriminal0000]{Criminal} Background and the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.hotbHalfling0000]{Halfling} Species complement this class well.

Foundry Note

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack roll if you have Advantage on the roll and the attack uses a Finesse or a Ranged weapon. The extra damage's type is the same as the weapon's type.

You don't need Advantage on the attack roll if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the target, the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition, and you don't have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

The extra damage increases as you gain Rogue levels, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue Features table.

As a Level 1 Character

As a Multiclass Character

  • Gain the following traits from the Core Rogue Traits table: Hit Point Die, proficiency in one skill of your choice from the Rogue's skill list, proficiency with Thieves' Tools, and training with Light armor.
  • Gain the Rogue's level 1 features, which are listed in the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbRogue00000000.JournalEntryPage.gJV8iDqdNhRMLi5r#class-features]{Rogue Features table}.

Expertise.title: Expertise
Expertise.hint: You gain Expertise in two of your skill proficiencies of your choice. Sleight of Hand and Stealth are recommended if you have proficiency in them.

Thieves' Cant.title: Thieves' Cant
Thieves' Cant.hint: You picked up various languages in the communities where you plied your roguish talents. You know Thieves’ Cant and one other language of your choice, which you can choose from the languages below.

FiaNLovfP6tnY4tD.hint: Your cunning mind is exceptionally difficult to control. You gain proficiency in Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

Expertise.name: Expertise
Expertise.description:
You gain Expertise in two of your skill proficiencies of your choice. Sleight of Hand and Stealth are recommended if you have proficiency in them.

At Rogue level 6, you gain Expertise in two more of your skill proficiencies of your choice.

Foundry Note

You will be prompted for your expertise choices as you level up.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack roll if you have Advantage on the roll and the attack uses a Finesse or a Ranged weapon. The extra damage's type is the same as the weapon's type.

You don't need Advantage on the attack roll if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the target, the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition, and you don't have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

The extra damage increases as you gain Rogue levels, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue Features table.

Current Sneak Attack Damage: [[lookup @scale.rogue.sneak-attack]]

Foundry Note

Your sneak attack damage will automatically scale as you level up. You can select the damage type in the damage roll's dialog box.

Thieves' Cant.name: Thieves' Cant
Thieves' Cant.description:
You picked up various languages in the communities where you plied your roguish talents. You know Thieves' Cant and one other language of your choice, which you choose from the language tables in @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbCreatingAChar.JournalEntryPage.t1WP9VEevo4TOTXw#choose-languages]{Character Creation}.

Foundry Note

Thieves' Cant will be added to your sheet automatically and you will be prompted to choose the additional language.

Weapon Mastery.name: Weapon Mastery
Weapon Mastery.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as Daggers and Shortbows.

Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery properties of Scimitars and Shortswords.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. On your turn, you can take one of the following actions as a Bonus Action: &Reference[Dash], &Reference[Disengage], or &Reference[Hide].

Steady Aim.name: Steady Aim
Steady Aim.description: As a Bonus Action, you give yourself Advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can use this feature only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use it, your Speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

Assassin.name: Assassin
Assassin.description:
Practice the Grim Art of Death

An Assassin’s training focuses on using stealth, poison, and disguise to eliminate foes with deadly efficiency. While some Rogues who follow this path are hired killers, spies, or bounty hunters, the capabilities of this subclass are equally useful for adventurers facing a variety of monstrous enemies.

Assassin's Tools.title: Assassin's Tools
Assassin's Tools.hint: You gain a Disguise Kit and a Poisoner’s Kit.

rvg1VPVkuaZrsvIx.title: Assassin's Tools
rvg1VPVkuaZrsvIx.hint: You have proficiency with your Assassin's Tools.

Poisoner's Kit.name: Poisoner's Kit
Poisoner's Kit.description:
Ability: Intelligence

Utilize: Detect a poisoned object (DC 10)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPoisonBasic]{Basic Poison}

Assasinate.name: Assasinate
Assasinate.description:
You’re adept at ambushing a target, granting you the following benefits.

Initiative. You have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

Surprising Strikes. During the first round of each combat, you have Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn. If your Sneak Attack hits any target during that round, the target takes extra damage of the weapon’s type equal to your Rogue level.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect which automates the advantage on Initiative rolls.

The Damage activity can be used to apply extra damage equal to your level. You can choose the damage type in the roll's dialog box. Alternatively, you could add your level ([[lookup @classes.rogue.levels]]) as a situational bonus to your normal damage roll.

damage.condition: Your Sneak Attack hits any target during the first round

Assassin's Tools.name: Assassin's Tools
Assassin's Tools.description:
You gain a Disguise Kit and a Poisoner’s Kit, and you have proficiency with them.

Foundry Note

The equipment and proficiencies are granted to you automatically as you level up.

Rogue (Level 3, Thief).name: Rogue (Level 3, Thief)
Rogue (Level 3, Thief).description:
Playing a Rogue

Choose this class if you want to play an antihero who launches deadly strikes while avoiding harm through stealth.

Rogue Tips. In combat, use a combination of stealth, positioning, and the Vex property of your Shortsword or Shortbow to make attacks with Advantage and deal extra damage with Sneak Attack. The Light property allows you to attack with your Dagger and Shortsword on the same turn, increasing the likelihood of this extra damage.

Your high Dexterity helps you escape notice (Stealth) and pick locks with your Thieves’ Tools (Sleight of Hand). You’re also a capable liar (Deception).

Recommended Origin. If you need help deciding your origin, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.hotbCriminal0000]{Criminal} Background and the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-borderlands.options.Item.hotbHalfling0000]{Halfling} Species complement this class well.

Lantern.name: Lantern
Lantern.description: A Lantern casts Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet. As a Bonus Action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to Dim Light in a 5-foot radius, or raise it again.

Thieves' Tools.name: Thieves' Tools
Thieves' Tools.description:
Ability: Dexterity

Utilize: Pick a lock (DC 15), or disarm a trap (DC 15)
